itemDescription: English cricketer and administrator, and rugby union footballer (1868-1930)

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Frederick Charles Toone (25 June 1868 – 10 June 1930), known as Fred Toone, was a cricket administrator, who in 1929 became the second man ever to be knighted for cricket-related activities. Unusually for a man who achieved such eminence in the game, he never played cricket at first-class level.
